result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: NiAl 2 O 3 catalysts and bulk Ni nanoparticles, with the average sizes of Ni particles varying from 2.7 nm to 238.0 nm, were synthesized and evaluated in CO 2 photoreduction with methane (CRM).It was found that the catalytic activities of the Ni-based catalysts were all increased almost linearly with light intensity in the range of 0-1.07 W cm -2 , with the optical properties of Niparticles being regarded to account for the activity enhancement.Wavelength dependent performance study suggested that Ni LSPR

specific catalyst serves as an indicator for the capacity of the catalyst to respond to light and accelerate the reaction rate, then in this sense, it could be speculated that smaller particle sizes of Ni particles possess stronger capacity in absorbing light and enhancing the catalyst activity. Reaction conditions: 550 C, CH 4 CO 2 1, flowrate 20.0 mLmin, 0.050 g catalyst, with and without light introduction. What's more, CO 2 conversion rates were always slightly higher than those of CH 4 due to the side

S10).This is reasonable, since the larger the Ni particle sizes, the less amount of available Ni active sites 25,26.Meanwhile, it's noticeable that the catalytic activities of NiAl 2 O 3 catalysts were further enhanced after the introduction of extra solar light irradiation (300 nm 800 nm, 0-1.07 W cm -2 , Fig. 2 and Fig. S9), whereas no obviously enhanced activity was observed over bulk Ni particles with further light introduction.The slope of activity enhancement over a specific catalyst serves as an

light assisted thermaldriven reaction system,the reaction temperature was well controlled and it was not photo-induced temperature increase that enhanced the performances of NiAl 2 O 3 catalysts.Previous studies on adopting Nibased catalysts in photo-involved reactions suggested that the optical property of Ni particles accounted for the activity enhancements 16,17. From the UV-vis spectra shown in Fig. 3a, it is clear over the Ni ), the absorption edge assigned to Al 2 O 3 could not beobserved (Fig. S13

the alumina cellcontaining the catalysts.CH 4 and CO 2 with the molar ratio of 11 were introduced into the reactor at a total flowrate of 20.0 mLmin (STP).The effluent gases were analyzed off-line by injection method on two separate gas chromatographies (GC).H 2 was analyzed on GC-8 A, Shimadzu Co., Japan, while CO, CO 2 and CH 4 were analyzed on GC-14B, Shimadzu Co., Japan.The flowrate of the effluent gas was measured with a flowmeter. Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: was conducted in a fixed-bed flow type reactor under atmospheric pressure shown in Scheme 1.A 0.050 g portion of catalyst without dilution was packed uniformly in the alumina cell.Both TC-1000 temperature controller (Jacso) and LA-251Xe lamp (Hayashi) with HA30 filter were employed to provide the energy input.Light with desired wavelength was generated by LA-251Xe lamp (Hayashi), filtered by a set of cut-off filters and introduced to the system via a quartz window just above the alumina cellcontaining the

the alumina cellcontaining the catalysts.CH 4 and CO 2 with the molar ratio of 11 were introduced into the reactor at a total flowrate of 20.0 mLmin (STP).The effluent gases were analyzed off-line by injection method on two separate gas chromatographies (GC).H 2 was analyzed on GC-8 A, Shimadzu Co., Japan, while CO, CO 2 and CH 4 were analyzed on GC-14B, Shimadzu Co., Japan.The flowrate of the effluent gas was measured with a flowmeter.
